ParticleSystem Class Reference

This class is the abstract picture of the particles that is invariant to a renderer. More...

#include <particle_system.hpp>

Detailed Description

This class is the abstract picture of the particles that is invariant to a renderer.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::vector<ParticleSystemActionPtr> ParticleSystem::Actions

A collection of Actions for a Particle System.

ParticleSystem::ParticleSystem ( int  initialCapacity = 100  ) 

This is the constructor for ParticleSystem.

initialCapacity The initial limit to the amount of particles accepted by the system.

Member Function Documentation

Actions& ParticleSystem::actionSet (  )  [inline]

void ParticleSystem::addAction ( ParticleSystemActionPtr  pAction  ) 

This method adds an action to the particle system.

An action may be added multiple times to the particle system to create a meta-action but it usually makes better sense to modify the attributes of an action to create the equivalent effect.

Parameters:
pAction A pointer to the action to be added.

void ParticleSystem::addFlareID ( uint32  id  )  [inline]

void ParticleSystem::addParticle ( const Particle &  particle,
bool  isMesh 
)

This method adds a newly created particle to the particle system.

It will not be added if adding the particle pushes the particle population beyond the capacity of the system.

Parameters:
particle The new particle to be added.
isMesh Boolean indicating whether the particles to add are a mesh.

bool ParticleSystem::attach ( MatrixLiaison *  pOwnWorld  )  [virtual]

This method attaches the particle system to the world via a matrix liason.

We give ourselves a ground specifier.

Parameters:
pOwnWorld The matrix liason that will provide our world matrix.
Returns:
True on success, false on error.

This is the const-accessor to the start of the vector of particles owned by the system.

A const iterator for the particles beginning at the start.

This is the accessor to the start of the vector of particles owned by the system.

BoundingBox The bounding box of the particle system.

void ParticleSystem::capacity ( int  number  ) 

This is the Set-Accessor for the capacity property.

Parameters:
number The new maximum number of particles allowed.

int ParticleSystem::capacity ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the capacity property.

This is the maximum number of particles in the system. We use a variable to store the capacity because the vector template only guarantees minimum size, so the actual capacity may be higher than the value we specified.

Returns:
The maximum number of particles allowed.

void ParticleSystem::clear ( void   ) 

This method tells the particle system to remove all particles from itself.

ParticleSystemPtr ParticleSystem::clone (  )  const

This method clones a particle system, but does not copy the current state of the particles.

Returns:
ParticleSystemPtr Smart Pointer to the cloned particle system.

void ParticleSystem::detach (  )  [virtual]

This method detaches the particle system from the existing matrix liason, undoing the attach operation.

void ParticleSystem::draw ( const Matrix &  world,
float  lod 
) [virtual]

This methods tells the particle system to draw itself.

Particles are stored in world coordinates so we do not need the attachment transform which is passed in.

This method draws the particle system with the given transform, and at the desired level-of-detail.

Parameters:
world The world matrix to render with.
lod The level-of-detail, or adjusted distance from the camera.

float ParticleSystem::duration (  )  const

This method returns the duration of the particle system.

The duration is only valid for particle systems containing at least one sink action that specifies a maximum particle age.

Returns:
float The duration of the particle system, or -1 if the particle system has no fixed duration.

void ParticleSystem::enabled ( bool  state  ) 

This is the Get-Accessor for the particle system's preview visible property.

Parameters:
state The new value of the particle system's visible flag.

bool ParticleSystem::enabled ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the particle system's preview visible flag.

If this flag is set then the particle system will not be rendered as part of the meta particle system.

Returns:
The current value of the particle system's visible flag.

Particles::const_iterator ParticleSystem::end ( void   )  const

This is the const-accessor to the end of the vector of particles owned by the system.

Returns:
A const iterator for the particles that is past the end of the vector.

Particles::iterator ParticleSystem::end ( void   ) 

This is the accessor to the end of the vector of particles owned by the system.

Returns:
An iterator for the particles that is past the end of the vector.

void ParticleSystem::enterWorld (  )  [virtual]

The method is called when the particle system has first entered the world.

Make sure to convert back to world coordinates when entering world.

const Vector3 & ParticleSystem::explicitDirection (  )  const

This method gets the explicit position of the particle system.

void ParticleSystem::explicitDirection ( const Vector3 &  dir  ) 

This method sets the explicit position of the particle system.

After calling this method, the particle system no longer uses the world space given to it; the system is always at this location.

This method gets the explicit position of the particle system.

This method sets the explicit position of the particle system.

After calling this method, the particle system no longer uses the world space given to it; the system is always at this location.

RompColliderPtr ParticleSystem::groundSpecifier ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the ground specifier of the particle system.

The ground specifier is actually a romp-collider. It is used to determine collision for the particle system.

Returns:
A smart pointer to the ground specifer.

void ParticleSystem::insertAction ( size_t  idx,
ParticleSystemActionPtr  pAction 
)

This method inserts an action to the particle system.

An action may be added multiple times to the particle system to create a meta-action but it usually makes better sense to modify the attributes of an action to create the equivalent effect.

Parameters:
idx The index at which to insert the action.
pAction A pointer to the action to be added.

bool ParticleSystem::isLocal (  )  const

Does the particle system use local space particles?

void ParticleSystem::isStatic ( bool  s  ) 

This method is called to set a flag on the particle system indicating it is static or not.

In reality this method only gets called with true. If true, then it means the particle system has been placed as a chunk item.

Parameters:
s static or not.

bool ParticleSystem::isStatic ( void   )  const [inline]

void ParticleSystem::leaveWorld (  )  [virtual]

The method is called when the particle system is leaving the world.

Make sure to convert back to local coordinates when leaving world.

void ParticleSystem::name ( std::string  newName  )  [inline]

std::string ParticleSystem::name ( void   )  const [inline]

Matrix ParticleSystem::objectToWorld ( void   )  const

This returns the worldTransform for the particle system, adjusted for options such a local/viewspace rendering.

It modifies the results of the worldTransform call, and as such should be used as the definitive version of the world transform for rendering.

Returns:
The object to world transform matrix for the Particle System.

ParticleSystemActionPtr ParticleSystem::pAction ( int  actionTypeID,
std::string const &  str 
)

This method finds the first occurrence of an action of type actionID from the particle system where the name is str.

This is in order of first-created.

Parameters:
actionTypeID The action type of the action to be accessed.
str The name of the action to search for. If this is empty then the first action of the appropriate id is found.

ParticleSystemActionPtr ParticleSystem::pAction ( int  actionTypeID  ) 

This method finds the first occurrence of an action of type actionID from the particle system.

This is in order of first-created.

Parameters:
actionTypeID The action type of the action to be accessed.

const ParticlesPtr ParticleSystem::particles (  )  const [inline]

void ParticleSystem::predictPosition ( const Particle &  particle,
float  dt,
Vector3 &  retPos 
)

This method moves a particle forward in time.

Parameters:
particle The particle to move
dt The delta time to apply
retPos [out] The new particle position.

void ParticleSystem::pRenderer ( ParticleSystemRendererPtr  pNewRenderer  ) 

This is the set-accessor for the particle system's renderer.

The old renderer, if any must have its reference count decremented before it is discarded by the particle system. Likewise, the renderer has its reference count incremented only if it is not NULL.

Note that assigning a new renderer recreates the particle container, as different renderers may have different containers.

Parameters:
pNewRenderer A pointer to the new renderer.

ParticleSystemRendererPtr ParticleSystem::pRenderer ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the particle system's renderer.

Returns:
A pointer to the particle system's renderer.

void ParticleSystem::prerequisites ( DataSectionPtr  pSection,
std::set< std::string > &  output 
) [static]

This static method returns all of the resources that will be required to create the particle system.

It is designed so that the resources can be loaded in the loading thread before constructing the particle system.

Parameters:
pSection The data section containing the particle system.
output The set of output resources that are prerequisites for creation of the particle system.

void ParticleSystem::removeAction ( ParticleSystemActionPtr  pAction  ) 

This method removes the action from the particle system.

Parameters:
pAction A pointer to the action to be removed.

void ParticleSystem::removeAction ( int  actionTypeID  ) 

This method removes the first occurrence of an action of type actionID from the particle system.

This is in order of first-created.

Parameters:
actionTypeID The action type of the action to be removed.

void ParticleSystem::removeFlareID ( uint32  id  )  [inline]

Particles::iterator ParticleSystem::removeParticle ( Particles::iterator  particle  ) 

This method removes a particle from the particle system.

The particle to be removed must be referenced via an iterator.

Parameters:
particle The iterator to the particle to be removed.

void ParticleSystem::save ( std::string  filename,
std::string  directory = "/particles/",
bool  transient = false 
)

This method saves a particle system, to a given filename and base directory.

Parameters:
filename The filename for the particle system.
directory Base directory path, prepended to filename.
transient Whether the save operation is transient. If set the false, the full visibility bounding box is recaculated for the save - this may take a few seconds.

bool ParticleSystem::serialise ( DataSectionPtr  pSect,
bool  load,
std::string  name = "",
bool  transient = false 
)

This method serialises the particle system with a name.

Serialising is saving OR loading.

Parameters:
pSect DataSection for the serialisation process.
load Whether to load or save the particle system.
name The name of the particle system.
transient If saving, whether it is transient. If set the false, the full visibility bounding box is recaculated for the save - this may take a few seconds.
Returns:
bool Success or failure of the operation.

void ParticleSystem::setDoUpdate (  )  [inline]

force particle system to update next time it's ticked.

void ParticleSystem::setFirstUpdate (  )  [inline]

int ParticleSystem::size ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the size property.

This is the current number of particles in the system. There is no set accessor for this property - it is read-only. We can use the size() method of the vector template for this as it is accurate.

Returns:
The current number of particles in the system.

size_t ParticleSystem::sizeInBytes (  )  const

This method returns the memory used by the particle system.

Returns:
size_t Size, in bytes, used by the particle system.

void ParticleSystem::spawn ( int  num = 1  ) 

This method spawns a number of particles on-demand.

Parameters:
num The number of particles to spawn.

bool ParticleSystem::tick ( float  dTime  )  [virtual]

This method updates the state of the particles for the time given.

There is a distinction made between the drones and non-drones. These are update slightly differently.

Parameters:
dTime Time since last update in seconds.

void ParticleSystem::tossed ( bool  isOutside  )  [virtual]

This method is called when we are tossed into the world.

Parameters:
isOutside Whether we are being placed inside or outside.

void ParticleSystem::transformBoundingBox ( const Matrix &  trans  )  [inline]

void ParticleSystem::update ( float  dTime  ) 

Update the particle systems for the given elapsed time.

Parameters:
dTime the delta frame time.

void ParticleSystem::updateBoundingBox (  )  [protected]

This method updates the bounding box of the system.

void ParticleSystem::windFactor ( float  ratio  ) 

This is the Get-Accessor for the particle system's wind factor property.

Parameters:
ratio The new value of the particle system's wind factor.

float ParticleSystem::windFactor ( void   )  const

This is the Get-Accessor for the particle system's wind factor.

If this value is zero then the particle is not affected by the window, if it is one then the velocity used is the velocity of the particle plus the velocity of the wind.

Infinity is represented by the negative number.

Returns:
The current value of the particle system's windFactor.

void ParticleSystem::worldBoundingBox ( BoundingBox &  bb,
const Matrix &  world 
) [virtual]

This accumulates our bounding box into the given matrix.

Parameters:
bb The resultant bounding box.
world The world transform.

Matrix ParticleSystem::worldTransform ( void   )  const

This returns the worldTransform for the particle system.

If the particle system is attached to a node, it uses that node's transform.

If there is no attached node, then the result is the identity matrix.

Returns:
The world transform matrix for the Particle System.

void ParticleSystem::worldVisibilityBoundingBox ( BoundingBox &  wvbb  )  [virtual]

This accumulates our visibility bounding box into the given variable.

Parameters:
bb The resultant bounding box.
